Articles.Content:
<p><figure data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" class="tmblr-full"><img data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" src="https://40.media.tumblr.com/e6b9796e0425d604ccf4dd4df2733721/tumblr_inline_nopupfOBis1rr2wit_540.jpg"/></figure><iframe src="http://www.twitch.tv/oaktree42/embed" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" height="378" width="620"></iframe></p>

<p>OakTree42 describes himself as someone who loves the game and tries to be entertaining, something that he certainly achieves. On his Twitch channel you’ll typically find him working on a scenario mission, his career mode or just having fun in Sandbox. OakTree42 is a knowledgeable and experienced player, and he’s more than happy to show people how the game works. Check out his <a href="http://www.twitch.tv/oaktree42" target="_blank" alt="OakTree42"><strong>Twitch channel</strong>{/a>.</a></p>

Thanks for this honor! Wasn't expecting this! I do have some highlights on my channel. I tend to stream during the daytime USA time. I'm currently working on a career mode where we are trying to colonize every moon, planet and whatever else we think of. This all courtesy of the Kerbal Science Institute (KSI) which looked up into the sky and realized there seemed to be no other kerbals out there so are out to spread across the system, and maybe if they are lucky find some other kerbals or something. But if not to make sure that there /are/ other kerbals out there when they are finished!

Side note: Every Wednesday at roughly 3 PM CST I do a viewer appreciation stream. This is where I take viewer requests for challenges, I will review craft, mods, or explain things on request as well. All I ask is you twitch message me by Monday evening so I can have some time to read through the requests and see what I have a chance to pull off. I am always surprised by the wonderful things my viewers come up to challenge me with! My most recent highlight video is of an Apollo 11 stock part replica challenge which turned out far better than I expected.

Hope to see you all around twitch if you get a chance!

-OakTree42 You can find me at: http://www.twitch.tv/oaktree42/ or on twitter @Oaktree42 (Oddly enough!)

I often watch your stream during my lunchtime, UK. You can call it, my daily dose of space.
